definitions.definition: ( chiefly poetic , dated or archaic ) Synonym of fountain ( “ a natural source of water ” ) ; a spring . [from late 16th c.]
( by extension , agriculture , archaic ) A device from which poultry may drink ; a waterer .
( figurative ) That from which something proceeds ; an origin , a source. [from early 17th c.]
examples: He is a real fount of knowledge!

main_definition: ( chiefly poetic , dated or archaic ) Synonym of fountain ( “ a natural source of water ” ) ; a spring . [from late 16th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( by extension , agriculture , archaic ) A device from which poultry may drink ; a waterer .
( figurative ) That from which something proceeds ; an origin , a source. [from early 17th c.]

definitions.definition: Synonym of font ( “ a set of glyphs of unified design , usually representing the letters of an alphabet and its supplementary characters belonging to one typeface , style , and weight ; a typeface; a family of typefaces ” ) .
definitions.label_groups: UK , printing , typography , chiefly dated , historical

main_definition: ( UK , printing , typography , chiefly dated , historical ) Synonym of font ( “ a set of glyphs of unified design , usually representing the letters of an alphabet and its supplementary characters belonging to one typeface , style , and weight ; a typeface; a family of typefaces ” ) . [from late 17th c.]
